abstract: Policy makers and conservationists largely ignore the issue of protecting invertebrates, even though those species play roles vital to ecosystems' survival.
snippet: Policy makers and conservationists largely ignore the issue of protecting invertebrates, even though those species play roles vital to ecosystems' survival.
lead_paragraph: "If human beings were to disappear tomorrow, the world would go on with little change," the biologist E.O. Wilson once wrote. But if invertebrates were to vanish, he said, "I doubt that the human species could last more than a few months."

headline.main: Where Is the Love for Bugs?
